<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 219, 649]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 730, 682]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 89]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 133, 561, 151]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 165, 240, 182]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 194, 384, 212]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 212, 581, 248]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 271, 228, 288]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 291, 752, 330]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 345, 495, 380]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 410, 384, 427]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 432, 534, 465]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\left\{2a + (n - 1)d\right\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 488, 336, 504]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = ar^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 508, 428, 577]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 610, 594, 628]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 643, 156, 660]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 670, 583, 721]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \mathrm{e}^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 765, 242, 782]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 791, 593, 826]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 826, 594, 846]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 852, 556, 881]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 467, 89]]<|/det|>
Solve the following simultaneous equations.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[453, 92, 551, 110]]<|/det|>
\[x + 5y = -4\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 112, 541, 131]]<|/det|>
\[3y - xy = 6\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 137]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 477, 96, 496]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 477, 418, 497]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(4\mathrm{e}^{2x - 3} = 7\mathrm{e}^{5 - x}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 477, 920, 496]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 413, 89]]<|/det|>
In this question \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 98, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve \(y = \frac{a}{x} +3x - 2\) at the point where \(x = 1\) has equation \(y = - \frac{1}{4} x + b\). Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 116, 920, 134]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 70, 586, 92]]<|/det|>
**DO NOT USE A CALCULATOR IN THIS QUESTION.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the points of intersection of the curves \(y = 7x^{3} - 7x^{2} - 17x - 4\) and \(y = x^{3} - 2x^{2} - 4x - 16.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 551, 92, 570]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 549, 920, 586]]<|/det|>
A 4-digit code is to be formed using 4 different numbers selected from 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9. Find how many possible codes there are if the code forms

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 597, 144, 616]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 597, 494, 616]]<|/det|>
a number that is odd and greater than 5000,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 597, 920, 616]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 768, 146, 787]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 768, 604, 787]]<|/det|>
a number greater than 5000 with a last digit that is prime.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 768, 920, 787]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 99, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 78, 146, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 490, 104]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\sin x}{1 - \cos x} + \frac{1 - \cos x}{\sin x} = 2 \csc x\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 98]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 485, 144, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 477, 789, 510]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\frac{\sin x}{1 - \cos x} + \frac{1 - \cos x}{\sin x} = 3 \sin x - 1\) for \(0^\circ < x < 360^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 481, 920, 500]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 473, 90]]<|/det|>
In this question all lengths are in centimetres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 101, 865, 121]]<|/det|>
The volume of a cylinder with radius \(r\) and height \(h\) is \(\pi r^2 h\) and its curved surface area is \(2\pi rh\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 715, 141]]<|/det|>
The volume of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(\frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\) and its surface area is \(4\pi r^2\).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 149, 571, 322]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 342, 920, 375]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a solid object in the shape of a cylinder of base radius \(r\) and height \(h\), with a hemisphere of radius \(r\) on top. The total surface area of the object is \(300 \mathrm{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 388, 144, 406]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 388, 455, 406]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(h\) in terms of \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 388, 920, 408]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 650, 144, 669]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 648, 589, 670]]<|/det|>
Show that the volume, \(V,\) of the object is \(150r - \frac{5}{6}\pi r^3.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 650, 920, 669]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 561, 88]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 440, 386, 460]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 441, 920, 460]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 662, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 91]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 444, 143, 463]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 444, 386, 463]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\sin B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 444, 920, 463]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 89]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A geometric progression has third term 4.5 and sixth term 15.1875. Find the first term and the common ratio. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 920, 104]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 116]]<|/det|>
The coordinates of points \(A\) and \(B\) are \((- 5, 6)\) and \((4, - 6)\) respectively. The point \(C\) lies on the line \(AB\), between \(A\) and \(B\), such that \(\frac{AC}{CB} = \frac{1}{2}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 123, 144, 141]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 123, 361, 141]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 123, 920, 141]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 370, 146, 389]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 370, 821, 389]]<|/det|>
The line \(CD\) is perpendicular to \(AB\). Find the equation of \(CD\) in the form \(y = mx + c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 370, 920, 389]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
